snippet: Computer algorithms are capable of trading stocks, arranging dates and winning “Jeopardy.” But increasingly, behind the curtain, there is a human helper.
abstract: Computer algorithms are growing ever more powerful, fast and precise, but the machines for which they are designed are literal-minded, and context and nuance often elude them; Twitter, Google and IBM are among companies that employ human helpers to rate and assess algorithms to interpret and tweak information in ways that are understandable to both computers and other humans.
lead_paragraph: Computer algorithms are capable of trading stocks, arranging dates and winning “Jeopardy.” But increasingly, behind the curtain, there is a human helper.

headline.seo: Computer Algorithms Rely Increasingly on Human Helpers
headline.main: Algorithms Get a Human Hand in Steering Web
headline.print_headline: Algorithms Get A Human Hand In Steering Web
